page.title: 11The western bypass
page.content: During 1985 the Department of the Environment has accepted the route of the old Yarmouth to Lowestoft railway line. This was in preference to a slightly more westerly route, avoiding Gorleston completely. There is, however, fierce local opposition since new open parkland would, in part, be converted into a roundabout. In addition another would have to be built on Beccles Rd. In all some twenty houses, at least, would be destroyed in building the road and two bridges at Lowestoft Rd and Church Lane. In September the first stage of the Southtown bypass came into operation when a dual carriage way was opened through Harfrey's Industrial Estate. Eventually the new road will extend across Breydon Water to Acle New Rd, providing the long awaited second river crossing.
